alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued November 09 at 8:03AM EST until November 09 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...From 1 PM to 4 PM EST this afternoon, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.0 feet, yards are flooded on Saint George Island, and water will begin covering the road leading to the island, especially if there is wave action. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides one to one and a half feet above normal. The next high tide at Piney Point is at 2:42 PM and 3:14 AM. The next high tide at Point Lookout is at 1:57 PM and 1:53 AM. The next high tide at Coltons Point is at 3:18 PM and 3:50 AM. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. St Marys River at Straits Point MLLW Categories - Minor 3.0 ft, Moderate 3.5 ft, Major 5.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.4 ft, Moderate 1.9 ft, Major 3.4 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 09/02 PM 3.0 1.4 1.4 1.0 Minor 10/02 AM 2.9 1.3 1.6 0.5 None 10/03 PM 3.2 1.6 1.6 1.0 Minor 11/03 AM 2.7 1.1 1.4 1.0 None 11/03 PM 3.1 1.5 1.6 2.0 Minor 12/03 AM 2.8 1.2 1.6 2.0 None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
